frameDefinitions: An Agent changes the filler of a  Role by placing a New filler in the position after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.
A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
This frame concerns a specific subset of Instances of a Type which are evaluated in terms of their similarity to a conceptual prototype of the Type.
frameExamples: If you <t>replace</t> me with a robot, who's gonna make excuses to your wife for you?
If this happens one more time, we 're going to <t>switch</t> operating systems.
The bottom of the wall is <t>supported</t> by the foundation.

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
listRoleDefinitions: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs actions resulting in the <fen>New</fen> entity occupying the position.
The <fen>New</fen> entity is the person or thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> sets to fill a <fen>Role</fen>.
The entity that formerly occupied the position.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> installs the New entity.
This role identifies where the <fen>Agent</fen> installs the <fen>New</fen> entity.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
The individual that changes their situation.
The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> had been using.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up using.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a change.
The <fen>Supporter</fen> acts to benefit the <fex name='Supported'>Supported</fex> by providing additional strength or stability.
The <fen>Supported</fen> is given strength through the assistance of the <fen>Supporter</fen>.
This role identifies when the support occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the support occurs.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
A thing or episode that is considered exemplary of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of things or events from which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
listRoleExamples: I don't know; perhaps you could substitute <fex>regular sugar</fex>.
If you substitute a 15' arm <fex>for the 50cm one</fex>, it works pretty well.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
<fex>Early in the twentieth century</fex>, such economic arguments buttressed the creation of a National Park Service.
<fex>In England</fex>, economic incentives are buttressed by closing certain overdoctored areas from new practices.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
